translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda's Vinaya that breaks the saṃgha

source_sentence: 卷第十八
translation: Vol. 18

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijingfeng of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等諦聽！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往昔時無佛出世，空有辟支佛，時時怜念貧乏，自資少於臥具飲食。
translation: In the past, when there were no buddhas appearing in the world and a pratyekabuddha in space, pitying those who were poor and had little provisions for their own bedding and food and drink.

source_sentence: 時世唯有辟支佛，此時辟支佛遊行，往至波羅痆斯城。
translation: At the time, there were only pratyekabuddhas in the world, and at that time, pratyekabuddhas traveled to the city of Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 居至一陶家輪舍所，亦有自餘商人等同共止息。
translation: He went to the monastery of a potter’s house and stayed there. There were also some other merchants who lived together with him.

source_sentence: 中有一人夜在房中，遂失大便不淨污地，夜總即去。
translation: One of the monks was staying in his room late at night, and as a consequence he lost his urinating buttocks and unclean dirty floors. Soon after midnight he departed.

source_sentence: 其聲聞緣覺，若不觀察，不預知其事。
translation: If śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas don't observe it, they won't know about it.

source_sentence: 辟支佛夜止宿，擬於明日平旦乞食。
translation: The pratyekabuddha stayed the night and intended to beg for food at dawn on the following day.

source_sentence: 主人入房，乃見房中糞污不淨。
translation: When the host entered the room, he saw that the dung in the room was dirty and impure.

source_sentence: 然而異生愚癡之類不識善惡，便發惡念報辟支曰：『汝出家人，脚不被刺，何因不出房外大便，在此房內而放不淨？』
translation: Yet, because ordinary foolish people don't know good and bad, they give rise to bad thoughts and report to the pratyekabuddhas, saying, 'You renunciants, your feet aren't pierced, so why don't you go outside the room to urinate or release impure things here inside the room?'

source_sentence: 于時主人以鎖鎖門口云：『汝今可於此房餓死。』
translation: The host then locked the door with a chain and said, 'Now, you can starve to death in this room.'

source_sentence: 爾時辟支佛作是思惟：『恐此主人後受苦報，我若開門自出，又恐嗔恨。』
translation: It was then that the pratyekabuddha thought, 'I'm afraid this host will be subject to painful retribution in the future, and if I open my door and leave it myself, I'm also afraid of anger.'

source_sentence: 默然居住。
translation: He lived in silence.

source_sentence: 至中食時，主人嗔息，命辟支曰：『可來喫食。』
translation: When he arrived at the midday meal, his host's anger stopped and he ordered the pratyekabuddha to say, 'Come and eat.'

source_sentence: 告曰：『我時已過更不食也。』
translation: He told them, 'It's past my time and I won't eat again.'

source_sentence: 『若如是者，今夜更宿，明旦食齋。』
translation: 'If that's the case, then tonight I'll sleep again and tomorrow morning I'll eat purification.'

source_sentence: 辟支佛以慈愍而攝受故，便即為住。
translation: Because the pratyekabuddha takes them in with kindness and pity, he then abides.

source_sentence: 至於明旦，造淨妙食供養辟支。
translation: On the morning, he prepared pure and wonderful food to make offerings to the pratyekabuddhas.

source_sentence: 是時辟支為欲利益此主人故，現身變化而為說法，或現神通，或身上出火，或身下出水，種種變現。
translation: Because they want to benefit this host, the pratyekabuddhas then manifest bodily transformations and preach for him, sometimes manifesting miraculous powers, sometimes fire coming out of their bodies, and sometimes water coming out of their bodies in various ways.

source_sentence: 其時主人見此神變，心切悔過，猶如迅風吹其大樹連根俱拔摧折而倒，此亦如是而自摧撲口云：『大聖！
translation: The host then saw this miraculous transformation and repented, just as if a sudden wind had blown the large tree's roots up and down and split them apart, and he said, 'Great sage!

source_sentence: 願暫下來，我今墮在染欲垢中，願慈拔我。』
translation: May you please temporarily come down, for now I'm falling into the stain of defilement and desire, and may you kindly pull me out.'

source_sentence: 佛更下來，其人禮足口發願言：『於聖者邊而發惡意，願無業報。
translation: When the Buddha came back down, that man bowed his feet and made a verbal vow, saying, 'I'll give rise to bad thoughts at the side of the noble one, wishing for the results of my actions.

source_sentence: 又願供養功德善根，於當來世咸得廣大財富自在，亦常供養諸佛如來，心無厭離。』」
translation: May I also make offerings to the good roots of merit and virtue, so that in future lives they'll all attain vast wealth and freedom, always making offerings to the buddhas and tathāgatas, and their minds won't tire of them.'

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時陶家人者，今影勝王是。
translation: At the time, the potter's family was the present-day King Jōshō.

source_sentence: 當於爾時向辟支佛，心懷惡意口出麁語，業成熟故，今刀刺脚閉在房中飢渴餓死。
translation: At the time, he addressed the pratyekabuddha with bad intentions and harsh words, and because his karma had matured, he now stabbed his feet with a knife and closed them in his room, hungry, thirsty, and starving to death.

source_sentence: 由生悔心發願力故，彼業成熟，得生王宮富貴多財，於世尊所，破二十種身見山峯，以慧穿穴，證得預流果。」
translation: Because of the power of the arousal of repentance and the arousal of the vow, their karma matures, they'll be born in the king's palace, rich and wealthy, break through 20 kinds of body views at the Bhagavān, penetrate the mountain peaks with wisdom, and realize the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 佛復告諸苾芻等：「行黑業者得黑果報，行白業者當成熟白業果，行黑白雜業者當得黑白雜業報。
translation: Again, the Buddha told the monks and others, Doing black karma will result in black fruit; doing white karma will ripen the results of white karma; and doing black-white mixed karma will result in black-white mixed karma.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 當捨黑業及黑白雜業，專修白業行，應如是學。」
translation: You should abandon black karma and black and white mixed karma and focus on the practice of white karma, and you should thus train.

source_sentence: 時諸臣佐來白大王：「其老王身今已亡。」
translation: The ministers and assistants then said to the king, That old king's body has now died.

source_sentence: 聞此語已悶落於地，於時以水灑面還得蘇醒，即入室為父持孝服，無人可諫令得離愁。
translation: After hearing these words, he fell to the ground in distress and then sprinkled his face with water and regained consciousness. He went into his room for his father's sake to observe filial piety, but there was no one to admonish him so that he would be freed from sorrow.

source_sentence: 時臣佐共議：「云何方便王得無愁？」
translation: The ministers and assistants then discussed together, How did the king of skillful means attain freedom from sorrow?

source_sentence: 當時南天竺國有伎樂人來，將至王所作諸伎樂。
translation: At the time, there were musicians from southern India who came to the king's place and played music.

source_sentence: 王心無樂，默然不對，不與善言，伎兒總去，遊行至世尊所，告言：「善哉丈夫！」
translation: The king's mind was unhappy, and he remained silent and didn't reply, didn't give good words, and the tricky boy went away in general.

source_sentence: 心生歡喜即打鼓作樂。
translation: The mind becomes joyous, and he beats the drum to make music.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊自即放光微笑，出種種光又如火星，其光或上或下，其光下至無間地獄。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān himself emitted a ray of light and smiled, producing various kinds of light as bright as the fire star, which either rose higher or lower, and its light descended down to the unremitting hell.

source_sentence: 光所到處，冷苦者即煖，熱者得清涼。
translation: Where the light reaches, cold and painful is warmth, and hot gets coolness.

source_sentence: 諸受苦者並得止息，皆作思念：「我得託生餘處。」
translation: Those who experience suffering will all attain calmness, and they'll all think, I can be reborn elsewhere.

source_sentence: 佛化一人於地獄中，告言：「汝等亦不託生餘處，為有異人放光明苦得止息。」
translation: When the Buddha transformed one person in hell, he told them, You won't be reborn elsewhere; if there are heretics who radiate light, their suffering will be stopped.

source_sentence: 諸罪人見彼化人，心生歡喜罪得消滅，皆得生人天處所，堪受聽四諦聖法。
translation: When the sinners see that transformation person, their minds become joyous and their sins are extinguished, and they're all born in the human or divine realm where they're able to hear the noble teaching of the four truths.

source_sentence: 其光上至四天王、三十三天，至阿迦尼吒天，光中說無常、苦、無我、空法頌，其光普照三千大千世界，還隨佛後。
translation: From that light up to the four heavenly kings and thirty-three gods, up to the Akaniṣṭha gods, in which he spoke the verse on impermanent, painful, selfless, and empty dharmas, his light shone universally over 3,000 great one-thousand worlds and returned after the Buddha.

source_sentence: 若世尊乃至無上菩提事，欲說往昔事時，其光合從後入。
translation: If the Bhagavān or even the unsurpassed bodhisattva wants to explain the past events, his light combines and enters from behind.

source_sentence: 若說當來之事，光從前入。
translation: If he explains future events, the light enters from the front.

source_sentence: 若說地獄事，其光從足下入。
translation: If he talks about hell, his light enters from the bottom of his feet.

source_sentence: 欲說畜生之事，光從脚跟後入。
translation: Wishing to talk about the affairs of animals, Guang entered through the heels of his feet.

source_sentence: 若說餓鬼之事，光從脚指中入。
translation: If he talks about the affairs of hungry ghosts, the light enters through his toes.

source_sentence: 若說人間生事，光從脚脛中入。
translation: If he talks about the affairs of human beings, that light enters from his feet and shin.

source_sentence: 若說轉輪王者，光從左手中滅。
translation: If he says wheel-turning king, the light disappears from his left hand.

source_sentence: 若說大轉輪王者，光來至右手中滅。
translation: If he says great wheel-turning king, the light comes to his right hand and ceases.

source_sentence: 若說天上之事，光於臍中滅。
translation: If he speaks of heavenly deeds, the light disappears in his navel.

source_sentence: 若說聲聞緣覺之事，光從於臂中滅。
translation: If he explains the things of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, the light disappears from his arm.

source_sentence: 若說辟支佛法，其光從眉間入。
translation: If he teaches the teaching of the pratyekabuddha dharma, that light enters between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 若說授記無上正真等正覺法，其光從頂入等，廣如前說。
translation: If he teaches the teaching of the unsurpassed true and perfect enlightenment, his light enters from the top of his head as explained above.

source_sentence: 時此光明到佛所，遶佛三匝眉間而入。
translation: That light then went to the Buddha, circled him three times between his eyebrows, and entered.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難陀合掌讚佛說伽他等廣說如前。
translation: It was then that Ānanda joined his palms in praise of the Buddha's teaching, such as Kātyāyana and explained it in detail as before.

source_sentence: 「千妙種種色，　　從口一道出；
translation: A thousand subtle forms of various colors emerged from the mouth one by one.

source_sentence: 遍照於十方，　　亦如日初出。
translation: It shines everywhere in the ten directions, just as the sun first rises.

source_sentence: 無我而說偈，　　聞者除憍慢；
translation: He teaches verses without self, And the hearers are rid of conceit.

source_sentence: 皆作佛因緣，　　無緣不放光，
translation: They all act as causes and conditions for the Buddha, Yet without any conditions they do not emit light.

source_sentence: 以伽他讚佛：　降伏諸怨等。」
translation: He praised the Buddha with a verse that praises him for subduing enemies and so forth.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「汝見彼伎兒於我歡喜打鼓作樂不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, Do you see that tricky boy who joyfully beats the drum and makes music for me?

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「我見也。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, I see it.

source_sentence: 佛復告阿難陀言：「此伎兒得辟支佛果，名雅和音。」
translation: Again, the Buddha told Ānanda, This tricky boy has attained the fruit of pratyekabuddhahood, which is called elegant and harmonious sound.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多語未生怨王：「我以教汝今得王位，今須建立令我作佛。」
translation: It was then that Devadatta said to the king of enemies who hadn't yet arisen, Now that I've taught you to attain kingship, I must establish it so that I can become a buddha.

source_sentence: 時王語提婆達多言：「佛身有金色，汝身無金色。
translation: The king then said to Devadatta, The Buddha's body has golden color, but your body has no golden color.

source_sentence: 若為建立令作佛耶？」
translation: What if it's for the sake of establishing and causing someone to become a buddha?

source_sentence: 復白王言：「我身作金色，斯亦可得。」
translation: Again, he said to the king, My body is golden-colored, so it can be obtained.

source_sentence: 其提婆達多即喚金匠報言：「於我身上令作金色。」
translation: Devadatta then summoned the gold smith and reported, Make my body golden-colored.

source_sentence: 金匠答曰：「聖者！
translation: The goldsmith answered, Sage!

source_sentence: 若能忍痛即可作得。」
translation: If you can tolerate pain, you'll attain it.

source_sentence: 答曰：「我能忍痛。」
translation: He replied, I can tolerate pain.

source_sentence: 金匠即以熱油塗身，受諸辛苦著金薄塗身。
translation: The gold smith then rubbed his body with hot oil and suffered all the hardships of suffering, wearing a thin gold coated body.

source_sentence: 別有苾芻問孤迦里迦苾芻曰：「提婆達多今者何在？」
translation: Another monk asked the monk Aṅgulikā, Where's Devadatta now?

source_sentence: 答曰：「為染身金色不在。」
translation: He replied, It's because the color of the dyed body isn't golden.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻聞已，即往彼看提婆達多，見受諸辛苦叫喚為身上金色。
translation: After hearing this, the monk went there to see Devadatta and saw that he suffered painful screaming and wailing for golden color on his body.

source_sentence: 苾芻即來白佛言：「其提婆達多，為身欲作金色受大辛苦。」
translation: The monk then came to the Buddha and said, That Devadatta wanted to make a golden color for his body and suffer great hardship.

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻言：「時提婆達多，非是今時為身金色辛苦，於往昔時為金帽辛苦至死。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, At the time, Devadatta, it wasn't because his body was golden and painful at the present time that he suffered from a gold hat in the past until he died.

source_sentence: 往昔之時於婆羅痆斯城，有一婦人，夫主遠行不在。
translation: In the past, there was once a woman in the city of Vārāṇasī whose husband lived far away from her.

source_sentence: 有一烏鳥來彼婦人前和美語聲。
translation: A crow bird came to the woman and greeted her with a sweet voice.

source_sentence: 其婦人言：『如汝美聲我婿平安早到，與汝金帽。』
translation: The woman said, 'Suppose you say, 'Such is your beautiful voice that my son-in-law arrives safely at dawn and gives you a gold hat.'

source_sentence: 不久中間夫婿到來平安至家，其烏復於彼婦人前還作美聲。
translation: Soon afterward, the husband's son-in-law came home safely, and the crow returned to make a beautiful sound in front of the woman.

source_sentence: 時彼婦人即擲金帽與烏，得已即東去西。
translation: The woman then tossed her gold hat and gave it to the crow, and when she got it, she left for the east and went west.

source_sentence: 別有鵄鳥為彼金帽，打彼烏頭落地而死。」
translation: Some other birds of prey gave them a gold hat, hit it on the crow's head, and died.

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時烏鳥者，今提婆達多是。」
translation: The Buddha said, That was the crow bird at that time, and now it's Devadatta.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, What do you think?

source_sentence: 此提婆達多，於往昔時為金帽故，有如是習性仍在，為彼金薄身受其辛苦。」
translation: This Devadatta, who used to wear a gold hat in the past, has this kind of conditioning nature that's still present because his golden body is weak and suffers from its hardship.

source_sentence: 又提婆達多白未生怨王言：「我建立王今得王位，須立我為佛。」
translation: Again, Devadatta said to the king of enemies who hadn't yet arisen, I established the king and now attain the king's throne; I must establish myself as a buddha.

source_sentence: 王言：「如來脚下有妙輪相，若為建立得號為佛？」
translation: The king said, There's a marvelous wheel mark beneath the Tathāgata's feet; if he establishes it, can he be called a buddha?

source_sentence: 提婆達多復白王言：「我能作足下輪相。」
translation: Devadatta then said to the king, I can make a wheel sign beneath my feet.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多，即召巧工問言：「汝頗能於我雙足下作輪相不？」
translation: Devadatta then summoned the skilled worker and asked, Could you make a wheel sign beneath my feet?

source_sentence: 其人答曰：「聖者！
translation: The man answered, Sage!

source_sentence: 若欲能受痛，我當為作。」
translation: If you want to be able to experience pain, I will do it for you.

source_sentence: 提婆達多言：「我能忍痛。」
translation: Devadatta said, I can tolerate pain.

source_sentence: 時匠念言：「其人有大氣力，若拓印時脚跟踏我，必因茲致死。」
translation: The artisan then thought, That man has great energy, and if he creates the seal, his feet will follow me, and I'll surely die as a result of this.

source_sentence: 便即語提婆達多言：「可向房中出脚，我即印上。」
translation: He then said to Devadatta, You may leave your feet in the room, and I'll put my seal on them.

source_sentence: 答匠言：「好。」
translation: The smith answered, Good.

source_sentence: 時匠即燒輪形鐵，如火色印其足下，其時受太辛苦。
translation: The artisan then burned the wheel shaped iron, which looked like a fire-colored mudrā under his feet and suffered too much pain at that time.

source_sentence: 時有苾芻來問孤迦里迦言：「其提婆達多今見何在？」
translation: A monk then came to Anāthapiṇḍika and asked, Where's Devadatta now?

source_sentence: 答曰：「今在一處作脚輪相。」
translation: He answered, Now, there's a place where I'll make the characteristic of my feet.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻往彼房所，看提婆達多。
translation: That monk then went to that room and looked at Devadatta.

source_sentence: 至彼見提婆達多，為作脚輪相，燒脚受大辛苦，痛聲叫喚。
translation: When he arrived there, he saw Devadatta making the shape of a footstool for him, burning his feet and suffering great pain and screaming with pain.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻，心生疑怪往如來所，唯佛能斷疑惑，白言：「世尊！
translation: That monk then had doubts in his mind and went to the Tathāgata's place, but only the Buddha was able to remove doubts and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見提婆達多，為作脚輪相，受大辛苦疼痛。」
translation: Seeing Devadatta, I made a footstool for him and suffered great pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻：「往昔之時亦為脚受苦，習性仍在。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, they also suffered pain for their feet, but their habituated natures are still present.

source_sentence: 如往昔時，雪山之中有一大象，下山飲水。
translation: As in the past, there was a great elephant in the Himalayas that came down from the mountain to drink water.

source_sentence: 有一野犴隨象後行，見象脚跡自作量度，我於此沒當生天上。
translation: There was a wild elephant following behind the elephant, and when he saw the footprints of the elephant's feet, he measured them for himself; I won't be born in heaven here.

source_sentence: 因茲跳擲，忽被枯木以查其身，遂便至死。」
translation: As a result, he jumped and was suddenly caught by dry wood to search his body, and then died.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, What do you think?

source_sentence: 時彼野犴即提婆達多是。
translation: That wild elephant at the time was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 當於爾時度量脚跡忘作觀意，今時還為脚輪受大苦痛。」
translation: At that point, he measured the footprints of his feet and forgot to contemplate them, and now he's still suffering great pain from the foot-wheel.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊在王舍城住耆闍崛山深遠藥叉宮中，時提婆達多白未生怨王：「我今立汝為王，汝可立我為佛。
translation: When the Bhagavān was staying at Rājagṛha, deep in the yakṣa palace on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in the city of Rājagṛha, Devadatta said to King Ajātaśatru, Now, I'll make you king, and you can make me buddha.

source_sentence: 然我今欲殺沙門喬答摩，王宜共我設諸方計。
translation: Now, however, I want to kill the ascetic Gautama, so it's advisable for the king to share my calculations with me.

source_sentence: 我今不知以何物打？
translation: Now, I don't know what to beat with.

source_sentence: 先打何處而令命終？」
translation: Where did you first beat him and cause his life to end?

source_sentence: 時有工巧，能造拋車，從南天竺國來至城中。
translation: At the time, there were skilled artisans who could build a chariot and came from the southern Indian country to the city.

translation: After hearing this, Devadatta ordered the skilled worker to tell him, Can you build a chariot drawn by five hundred people?

source_sentence: 答言：「我今善解造此拋車。」
translation: He replied, Now, I'll skillfully understand the creation of this tossed chariot.

translation: Devadatta then took the throat jewel worth a thousand pieces of gold and gave it to skillful artisans to make this chariot, and again gave it to another thousand people as his messenger. source_sentence: 復於餘處安二百五十人拋車。
translation: At another place, he placed two hundred and fifty people tossed their chariots.

translation: He told the people, You should know that the ascetic Gautama is traveling and coming and going, and he's throwing down a chariot to kill you.

source_sentence: 時彼人等受提婆達多教已，即詣鷲峯山上，造五百人拋車畢。
translation: Those people then, having received the teaching from Devadatta, went up to Vulture Peak and built five hundred chariots.

source_sentence: 時五百人共相議曰：「造此大拋車欲害世尊。」
translation: The five hundred people then conferred with each other, creating this great chariot of emission in order to harm the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 悉作是言：「汝等應知，寧各捨命，不害人天所共恭敬大聖世尊身。」
translation: They all said, You should know that you'd better abandon your lives and not harm the body of the great sage Bhagavān, which is commonly respected by humans and gods.

source_sentence: 作是語已即捨拋車，便從山頂求覓僻路而下，恐提婆達多見。
translation: After he said this, he abandoned his chariot and went down from the top of the mountain to search for a secluded path, lest Devadatta see it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知諸人所念，便化階道，眾人見已各相議曰：「此峻高山先無階道，汝等應當知，此是世尊威德。」
translation: Knowing what the Bhagavān thought, the Bhagavān then transformed the steps and paths, and when the people saw each other, they each argued among themselves, saying, This is because there were no steps on this precipitous high mountain; you should know that this is the Bhagavān's authoritative qualities.

source_sentence: 于時諸人於佛如來發大清信，便於階道而下至世尊所。
translation: The people then had great pure faith in the Buddha Tathāgata, so they went down the steps to the Bhagavān's place.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為彼諸人欲調伏故，經行鷲峯山，既至佛所頂禮雙足退坐一面，欲聽法故。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān wanted to subdue those people, so he walked up Vulture Peak and went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew, and sat to one side because he wanted to listen to the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼根性意樂隨眠，為說如是四諦令其開悟。
translation: Knowing their faculties, natures, intentions, and latencies, the Bhagavān then explained these four truths for them so that they would be enlightened.

translation: Because the Bhagavān has caused me to realize the fruit of liberation, this isn't something parents, human kings, gods, ascetics, priests, friends, or members of their retinues can do.

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛法僧寶，受五學處，始從今日乃至命終，不殺生乃至不飲酒。
translation: World-Honored One, I now take refuge in the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha. Having undertaken the five kinds of training, from today until the end of my life, I will not kill living beings or drink alcohol.

translation: Please let the Bhagavān realize that I am Upāsaka.

translation: The artisan then felt angry because he thought he had harmed the Buddha, so he took the throat-jewel and fled on his own.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多數數遙望，謂佛世尊頭以落地，見佛安然了無損害。
translation: Devadatta then looked a long distance and said, The Bhagavān, the Buddha, landed with his head on the ground, and saw that the Buddha was peaceful and unhurt.

source_sentence: 覩五百人佛所聽法，遂起嗔恨餘路登山，乃見工師持珠私走，因此自更將五百人欲發拋車。
translation: When the five hundred people who saw that the Buddha was listening to the teaching, they became angry and climbed up the other side of the mountain. Then they saw the carpenter walk away in private with the pearl in his hand. So they led the five hundred people on their own, intending to abandon the chariot.

source_sentence: 佛作此念：「是我宿業積集成熟業報來至，欲水暴流無能止息退。
translation: The Buddha had this thought, 'This is the result of accumulating past actions and maturing past actions that I've accumulated in the past, and there's no way to stop or retreat from the raging current of desire.

source_sentence: 自作自受，若他受者無有是處。」
translation: It's self-made and self-accompanied, and there's no place for someone else to receive it.

source_sentence: 佛知業已告五百人曰：「諸仁當知！
translation: Knowing about his actions, the Buddha told the five hundred people, Gentlemen, you should know!

source_sentence: 提婆達多甚惡意，欲將汝等身登鷲峯山，此是我業決定須受，可共前進。」
translation: Devadatta's very bad intention is to take you up Vulture Peak, and this is the action that I will surely have to undergo, so let's go together.

source_sentence: 時諸天等便觀下方，于時執金剛藥叉便作是念：「此提婆達多既興惡逆欲害如來。」
translation: The gods then looked downward, and Vajra Yakṣa then had this thought, This Devadatta has committed a heinous act of wanting to harm the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 作是念已，即往金毘羅藥叉宮，報藥叉曰：「提婆達多於鷲峯山頂造大撞車，飛大拋石欲害佛身。
translation: Having had this thought, he went to the yakṣa's palace in Kimbila and reported to Yakṣa, saying, Devadatta built a large chariot at the top of Vulture Peak and flew away with a large ejection that wanted to harm the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 世尊既在汝宮安住，提婆達多正發石之時，我當以金剛杵於虛空中而摧碎之，汝應相助；
translation: The World-honored One is already abiding in your palace. When Devadatta is about to raise the stone, I will crush it into space with a vajra and you should assist me.

source_sentence: 恐有碎石迸著佛身，汝應覆護。」
translation: I'm afraid that a broken stone will burst into the Buddha's body, so you should cover it and protect it.

source_sentence: 金毘羅曰：「善哉！
translation: Kimbila said, Good!

translation: So it is.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從座而起，將入深山巖穴之內。
translation: The Bhagavān then rose from his seat and was about to enter the deep mountain cave.

source_sentence: 于時提婆達多與五百人發機飛石直擊如來。
translation: Devadatta and his five hundred men then flew up with their airplanes and rocks and directly struck the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時執金剛神以金剛杵於虛空中打石令碎，其石一片欲墮佛身。
translation: The Vajra spirit then took the vajra and struck a stone in the sky with a vajra, causing it to break apart, and one part of that stone was about to fall into the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 時金毘羅藥叉接石不著，遂打自身，從斯迸落損世尊足。
translation: At that time the yakṣa Jinpiluo, who had grasped the stone and didn't touch it, then struck himself, burst into flames, and injured the Bhagavān's feet.

source_sentence: 「非在虛空中，　　非海非山穴；
translation: “They are not in space, They are not oceans or mountain caves.

source_sentence: 無有地方所，　　能免於業報。」
translation: There's no place where they can avoid the results of their actions.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即說頌曰：時金毘羅藥叉被石擊身自知必死，便發善念：「命終之後生三十三天。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke a verse, saying, At the time, Kumārajīva Yakṣa was struck by a stone and knew he would surely die, so he had this good thought, After his life ends, he'll be born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 諸天常法，得生天已起三種念：一者今在何處？
translation: In the eternal law of gods, there are three kinds of thoughts that arise after they're born in heaven: first, where are they now?

source_sentence: 二者因何得生？
translation: What are the causes that give rise to the second?

source_sentence: 三者復因何業而得生此？
translation: Third, what is the karmic cause that gives rise to this?

source_sentence: 既審觀已知是天處。
translation: Having examined and observed it, he knows it's a heavenly place.

source_sentence: 復知前世身為藥叉，於佛世尊發清淨意，得生廣勝三十三天。
translation: He also knows that in a previous life he was a yakṣa, and when the Bhagavān arouses pure intentions toward the Buddha, he'll be born in the thirty-three gods of Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 復作是念：「我得生天，不應經宿受茲妙樂然後見佛，宜時速往敬禮世尊。」
translation: Again, he thought, I'll be born in heaven; I shouldn't experience this marvelous bliss for the night and then see the Buddha; it's a good idea to quickly go there and venerate the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 作是念已，即於身手遍嚴瓔珞殊特妙好，并持四種蔓陀羅等微妙蓮花，其天首髮柔軟香潔右旋紺青，身相端嚴不可比喻，威儀庠序下鷲峯山，以天威力光明赫奕遍照山野。
translation: After he had this thought, his body was adorned with a necklace of four kinds of subtle lotus flowers, such as the white lotus flower and its celestial neck was soft, fragrant, and shining blue to the right. translation: Having approached the Buddha, they scattered flowers to make offerings and withdrew to sit at one side in order to hear the Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼根性意樂隨眠，為說如是四真諦法，令其開悟。
translation: Knowing their faculties, natures, intentions, and latencies, the Bhagavān then taught them these four true truths so that they would awaken.

translation: Having heard the Dharma, he destroyed the mountain of body and views of the twenty existences with the vajra of wisdom and realized the fruit of stream-winner.

translation: Because the Bhagavān, the Buddha, has caused me to realize the fruit of liberation.

source_sentence: 親承諸佛大慈悲，　　眾惡皆除得天眼。」
translation: They personally inherit the great compassion of the buddhas, and all their evils are removed by attaining the divine eye.

source_sentence: 即於佛前而說頌曰：是時前身藥叉天神，如商人得利、如耕夫收實、如戰者得勝、如病得除，依舊威儀禮佛而去。
translation: He then spoke a verse in front of the Buddha, saying, At that point, the yakṣa gods and goddesses in his previous body, like merchants who attain profit, like plovers who gather grain, like fighters who attain victory, and like illnesses that are healed, paid homage to the Buddha with their usual manner and departed.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻始從初夜至後夜分，各自禪念，忽見佛前光明遍照，皆生疑惑詣佛請白：「有何因緣？
translation: The monks then began to meditate from the first watch of the night until the latter watch of the night, and when they suddenly saw the Buddha's light shining everywhere in front of them, they all had doubts and went to the Buddha and asked, What's the reason?

source_sentence: 梵釋諸天四天大王眾，來此奉覲。」
translation: The Brahmas, the gods, and the great kings of the four heavens came here to pay their respects.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「此非梵天，亦非帝釋四天王眾來此謁我，由提婆達多於鷲峯山作大拋車飛石打我，執金剛神以金剛杵空中打碎，時金毘羅藥叉接承不得，遂打自身。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, This isn't a Brahma god or Indra, nor are the four celestial kings from the four heavenly kings coming to see me here; Devadatta struck me with a flying stone on Mount Vulture Peak with a large chariot and flew it up into the air while holding a vajra spirit in the air and crushed it with a vajra pounder, but then the Vajra

translation: At the end of his life, he arouses good intentions and is born in the Trāyastriṃśa gods. Because of this, they come to pay homage to me.

source_sentence: 我為說法，得見真諦歸還天已。
translation: I teach the Dharma for them, and they return to heaven after seeing the true truth.

source_sentence: 是故苾芻！
translation: Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 若作黑業得黑果，作純白業得純白果，若作雜業必受雜果。
translation: If someone does black karma, they'll attain black fruit; if they do pure white karma, they'll attain pure white fruit; and if they do mixed karma, they'll surely experience mixed fruit.

source_sentence: 宜捨黑雜業唯集白業，當如是學。」
translation: It's advisable to abandon black and mixed karma and gather only white karma, and you should thus train.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻皆生疑惑而白佛言：「金毘羅藥叉為護佛故自喪身命。」
translation: The monks then all had doubts and said to the Buddha, Kimbila Yakṣa lost his own life for protecting the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「非但今日為我喪命，於過去生亦為我故自喪身命。
translation: The Buddha said, Not only will you lose your life today for me, but you'll also lose your own life in a past life for me.

source_sentence: 汝應善聽！
translation: You should listen well!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔波羅痆斯國有王名曰梵授，正法理國無諸枉濫。
translation: In the distant past, there was a king named Brahmadatta in the country of Vārāṇasī, and the country of right teaching and principle had no injustices.

source_sentence: 時世清淨人無災害，五穀豐盈萬姓安樂。
translation: The pure people of the world at that time had no disaster, and the five grains were abundant and all their families lived in peace.

source_sentence: 當爾之時去城不遠有別聚落，多諸園林勝妙花果，雜類諸鳥和鳴可愛。
translation: At the time, not far from the city, there was a separate village that had many beautiful flowers and fruits in its gardens and forests, and various kinds of birds were singing harmoniously and pleasingly.

source_sentence: 時有仙人住此林內，絕粒苦行唯食根果，被樹皮衣以禦寒暑。
translation: At the time, there was a sage living in this forest who practiced austerities such as cutting down grains and eating roots and fruits. He wore robes made of bark to protect him from cold and heat.

source_sentence: 即於此處有一獵師，每持弓矢殺諸禽獸而自存養。
translation: At that place, there was a hunter who always killed animals with bows and arrows to sustain himself.

source_sentence: 而此獵師於時林間往仙人所，仙見歲寒往來疲乏，心生愍念，乃將根果與之令食，遂結恩義共為父子。
translation: The hunter went to the place where the ṛṣi was staying in the forest at that time. When the ṛṣi saw that he was exhausted by the cold season and came back and forth, he had a compassionate thought and gave him some roots and fruits so that he could eat them. So he arranged an alms-giving ceremony for his father and son.

source_sentence: 是時獵師敬事仙人稱之為父，仙亦憐愍愛之如子。
translation: At the time, the hunter respected the sage and called him his father, and the sage had pity for him and loved him like a child.

source_sentence: 後於異時其梵授王清晨縱觀入鹿園中，時有野鹿驚怖悲鳴急投仙人，時王即便射殺此鹿。
translation: On another occasion, the king of Brahmadatta entered the deer park in the morning and saw a wild deer that was frightened and cried out in distress and rushed to the holy man.

source_sentence: 既見命終，仙乃發憤報彼王曰：『汝之惡性深非道理，彼鹿投我輒事屠害。』
translation: When he saw his death, the sage became angry and reported to the king, saying, 'Your bad nature is deeply unreasonable; that deer threw itself into me and was simply slaughtered.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已極生瞋恚告諸臣曰：『若有世人於灌頂剎帝王加麁惡語，合科何罪？』
translation: After hearing this, the king became extremely angry and told his ministers, 'If there are people in the world who speak harshly at the consecration of the king of the buddhas, what's the crime for them to be punished?'

source_sentence: 群臣白王：『非法惡人合當死罪。』
translation: The ministers said to the king, 'An unlawful and bad person will be guilty of committing the sin of death.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『然此仙人輕毀於我。』
translation: The king said, 'Suppose this sage despises me.'

source_sentence: 其時群臣欲害仙人，獵師近見便作是念：『我見命存，豈彼敢害大仙人也。』
translation: When the ministers wanted to harm the sage, the hunter saw him approaching them and thought, 'I see that my life is still alive, so why would they dare to harm the great sage?'

source_sentence: 是時獵師即共決戰，仙人避走。
translation: The hunters then decided to fight together, and the sages fled.

source_sentence: 時王爾時有大威勢，其時獵師便被王殺害。」
translation: At that point, the king had great authority, and then the hunter was killed by the king.

source_sentence: 佛言：「諸苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Monks!

source_sentence: 汝意云何？
translation: What do you think?

translation: The sage at the time was me.

source_sentence: 時獵師者，即前身藥叉天神是也。
translation: The hunter at the time was the yakṣa deity from the previous body.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，已為我故喪失身命。
translation: At that point, you've lost your body and life for my sake.

source_sentence: 今還為我遂便致死，石打我足流血如是不絕。」
translation: Now, it's still for my sake that I'll die, and the stone strikes my feet and bleeding blood doesn't stop.

translation: The Bhagavān endured the pain, and then the king of doctors came to the Buddha three times a day at the third watch every day to attend Śākyamuni, who was accompanied by the king of doctors. source_sentence: 時諸眾人白醫王言：「作何醫方？」
translation: The people then said to the king of doctors, What's the doctor's prescription?

source_sentence: 醫王答言：「我解此方，其藥難得。」
translation: The king of doctors replied, I understand this prescription, but its medicine is difficult to obtain.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀問醫王曰：「是何藥草，難可求得？」
translation: Ānanda then asked the king of doctors, What's the medicine and herbs that are difficult to obtain?

source_sentence: 答言：「此方用牛頭栴檀香，我先已於諸處求覓不得，縱令商人有者，怕未生怨王惡性，不敢出賣。
translation: He replied, Here's the ox-head sandalwood fragrance, which I had previously searched everywhere but couldn't find, and even if I were to allow a merchant to have it, I'm afraid they wouldn't give rise to the bad nature of enemies and kings, so I wouldn't dare to sell it.

source_sentence: 王若須者，方始將出獻王。
translation: If the king requires it, he'll then begin to offer it to the king.

source_sentence: 王若須香之日，無可與王必定被殺。
translation: If the king asked for a fragrance, he couldn't give it to him and would surely be killed.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 為曾賣栴檀香來，已知有其香故。」
translation: It's because he once sold sandalwood incense and knew it had the fragrance.

source_sentence: 時賣香商人在其眾中，聞侍縛迦所說，為世尊治病故，須栴檀香，便作是念：「未生怨王共提婆達多親愛，於世尊相嫉。
translation: When the incense-selling merchant was among the crowd, he heard what Śāriputra said, and because the Bhagavān was curing his illness, he needed sandalwood incense, so he thought, An enemy king who's not yet born with Devadatta is intimate with him and jealous of the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 若聞我與世尊牛頭栴檀香時，定當損我。」
translation: If someone hears me give the Bhagavān the ox-head sandalwood incense, they'll surely harm me.

source_sentence: 復作是念：「世尊是諸人天應供，我為此縱其身命被損，亦須奉上如來牛頭栴檀香。」
translation: Again, he thought, Bhagavān, these are the offerings that should be offered by humans and gods; for this reason, even if their bodies and lives are harmed, they must also offer the Tathāgata's ox-head sandalwood incense.

source_sentence: 即往取香來供養佛，[跍*月]跪白言：「世尊！
translation: He went there to fetch the incense and offered it to the Buddha, knelt down [twenty*moon], and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我得栴檀香來，世尊慈愍須當受取。」
translation: I'll get the sandalwood incense, and the Bhagavān will have to accept it with kindness.

source_sentence: 佛告具壽阿難陀言：「此大仁邊為受取栴檀香。」
translation: The Buddha told Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, This is the great benefactor who took the sandalwood incense at the side to receive it.

source_sentence: 依命受得。
translation: They rely on life to receive and attain it.

source_sentence: 商人生大歡喜，頭面禮佛退而還去。
translation: The merchant was greatly delighted, bowed his head and face to the Buddha, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊微笑，有五色光現青黃赤白，皆從口出，乃至其光於眉間入。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān smiled, and a five-colored light appeared blue, yellow, red, and white, all coming out of his mouth until its light entered between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 廣如上說。
translation: It's explained in detail as above.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀以偈讚佛，廣說如前。
translation: Ānanda then praised the Buddha in verse and explained it as before.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「汝見彼商人心生歡喜，以牛頭栴檀香供養於我不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, Do you see that merchant's mind rejoicing and offering me an ox-head sandalwood incense?

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「我見。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, I see it.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「如彼商人，以無量善根敬信，捨施牛頭栴檀香，於未來世當證辟支佛果，名曰栴檀。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, Suppose that merchant respectfully believes in measureless good roots and gives up the ox-head sandalwood fragrance, which will be called sandalwood in a future life when he realizes the fruit of pratyekabuddhahood.

source_sentence: 因於我處生大歡喜，當得是報。」
translation: Because of the great joy that arises in my place, you'll attain this reward.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊得此檀香塗足，血猶不止。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had this sandalwood incense applied to his feet, and his blood didn't stop.

source_sentence: 侍縛迦復白佛言：「用童女人乳汁塗點瘡上。」
translation: Again, the attendant Śākyamuni said to the Buddha, Use the milk juice of a young woman's milk to rub it on the sores.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻心怪不識童女乳汁，時具壽阿難陀問侍縛迦言：「何者是名童女乳汁？」
translation: The monks then wondered in their minds that they didn't know the milk juice of the girl's milk, and Kauśāmbī Ānanda asked the attendant Kālôdayin, What's called the milk juice of the girl's milk?

source_sentence: 答曰：「若婦人初妊胎生子者，是名童女乳汁。」
translation: He answered, If a woman's first pregnancy gives birth to a child, this is called the milk of a young woman.

source_sentence: 爾時四眾往詣諸處，求覓童女乳汁，在王舍城中除提婆達多及諸近友，於餘外四眾處，皆求此乳。
translation: It was then that the fourfold assembly went to various places to search for the milk juice of the young woman's milk, and in Rājagṛha, except for Devadatta and his close friends, the other four assemblies elsewhere all sought this milk.

source_sentence: 其提婆達多及諸惡友唱言：「汝等勿與乳汁。」
translation: The Devadatta and his bad friends called out, Don't give me milk.

source_sentence: 當欲作厭魅幻化之法，自無與心障破一切人。
translation: They want to create a demon of disillusionment and illusory dharmas that themselves lack the mental hindrances and destroy all people.

source_sentence: 爾時是王舍城中唯有一婦人，身自瘦小，初生孩子身亦瘦小，其母乳汁子食猶不得足，況故更與他人。
translation: At the time, there was only one woman in Rājagṛha whose body was small by itself, and when she first gave birth to a child, her body was also small, so she didn't have enough milk or juice to feed it, so why would she give it to someone else?

source_sentence: 時彼婦人聞佛世尊須童女乳汁，便作是念：「我若以用乳供養如來，我自瘦弱多有禍起：一者子當必死、二者提婆達多與王親近，及有宿舊朋友，聞與乳必當殺我。」
translation: When that woman heard that the Bhagavān needed the milk of the young woman's milk, she thought, If I were to offer milk to the Tathāgata, I would surely be emaciated and have many misfortunes: first, my child would surely die; second, Devadatta would become intimate with the king; and third, there would surely be an old friend from a past life who hears me give milk

source_sentence: 復作是念：「若我身死并我子亡，為天人應供養者，念患足指疼痛，我當持乳將供養如來。」
translation: Again, he thought, If my body dies and my child dies, and gods and humans should make offerings to me, then I'll carry the milk and make offerings to the Tathāgata if I'm suffering from pain in my feet.

source_sentence: 時彼婦人出乳置於銅器中，持將往如來所，頭面禮足[跍*月]跪奉佛，白言：「世尊！
translation: The woman then produced milk and placed it in a copper vessel, took it, went to the Tathāgata, bowed her head and feet [twenty*moon], knelt down to pay homage to him, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我將女乳來，聞佛須童女乳，我今將來，願佛受取此乳。」
translation: I'll bring the milk of my daughter and hear that the Buddha requires the milk of a young woman, and now that I'm about to come, may the Buddha accept this milk.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此女人心懷正信，汝當受取此乳。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, This woman has right faith in her heart, so you must accept this milk.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀依命受得，婦人頭面禮佛退還而去。
translation: Ānanda then accepted it according to his order, and the woman bowed her head and face to the Buddha, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊微笑放五色光，其光遍滿三千，廣如上說。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān smiled and emitted a five-colored ray of light, which pervaded 3,000 parts as explained above.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀言：「汝見彼女人將乳來供養我不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, Do you see that woman bringing milk to make offerings to me?

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見。」
translation: I see it.

source_sentence: 佛復告阿難陀：「此人以歡喜心捨施乳來供養於我，以此無量善根，當來之世得證辟支佛果。」
translation: Again, the Buddha told Ānanda, This person gave up milk with joy and came to offer it to me as an offering, and because of these measureless good roots, they'll attain the fruit of pratyekabuddhahood in a future life.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊瀝乳塗瘡血流不息，諸方苾芻及梵志等，聞佛患瘡皆來佛所，或有塗香粖香安於瘡上，種種醫療竟不能差。
translation: The Bhagavān then poured milk and rubbed it on the sores, and the blood didn't stop flowing, and the monks and priests in various directions heard that the Buddha was suffering from sores when they came to the Buddha, or that some of them had coated their sores with ointments and scents and placed them on the sores, which couldn't be healed by various medicines.

source_sentence: 爾時具壽十力迦攝波，以真實語發大誓願：「若佛世尊，於一切眾生普作子想，實不虛者，令血止息瘡得平復。」
translation: It was then that the Kāśyapa of the Ten Powers of the Buddha of longevity made a great vow with true words, If the Bhagavān, the Buddha, universally conceives of all sentient beings as children and really isn't false, he will cause the blood to stop and the sores to be healed.

source_sentence: 作是願已，血便止息瘡即除差。
translation: After making this vow, the blood stops and the sores are immediately healed.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦及王舍城一切道俗，皆大歡喜踊躍無量。
translation: The monks, nuns, Upāsaka, Upāsaka, Upāsaka, and all the religious practitioners in Rājagṛha then rejoiced greatly and jumped with immeasurable joy.

source_sentence: 唯提婆達多與未生怨王，并拘迦里迦惡苾芻等，心不歡喜，口云：「得病差者，誠為善哉，因此能有諸善根故。」
translation: Only Devadatta and the king of enemies who had yet to arise, as well as the bad monks Kauśika and others, weren't delighted at heart and said, It's really good that you've gotten rid of your illness, because this is how you can have good roots.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻皆生疑惑，唯佛世尊能斷除之。
translation: The monks then all had doubts and doubts, but only the Bhagavān could remove them.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有何因緣？
translation: What are the reasons for this?

source_sentence: 十力迦攝發誓願已，血流止息瘡得除差。」
translation: After the ten-powerful Kāśyapa makes this vow, the blood flows and calms sores will be healed.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「非但今日有此因緣，過去世時亦有此事。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Not only is there this cause and condition today, but there were these things in a past life.

source_sentence: 汝應諦聽！
translation: You should listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往過去我被毒瘡，彼發實語已得除差。
translation: In the past, I suffered from a poisonous sores, and they told me the truth and got rid of it.

source_sentence: 乃往昔時於一山野有一大村，去村不遠有大叢林，多饒根果。
translation: In the distant past, there was a large village in a wilderness on a mountain. Not far from the village is a large jungle forest that produces plenty of roots and fruit.

source_sentence: 異類諸鳥在此栖遊，出和雅音甚可愛樂。
translation: Various birds of different species roam here, producing harmonious sounds that are very pleasing.

source_sentence: 有一仙人止住其中，但食根菓飲清流水，被樹皮衣專持神呪，於此村內有一長者，在於宗族娶一女人，以為夫妻共為歡樂，於後不久妻便有娠。
translation: A sage stayed there, ate the roots and fruits [of the tree] and drank from the clear stream of water. He was dressed in bark sandalwood robes and exclusively engaged in supernatural magical spells. In this village an elderly man came to marry a woman belonging to his clan for the sake of enjoyment of both husband and wife. Soon afterward her wife became pregnant.

source_sentence: 歲月滿已誕生一子，滿三七日設會立名，字之喜樂。
translation: On the full thirty-seventh day, he set up an assembly to establish his name, which was named Joyful.

source_sentence: 長成已，或時經行、或時坐臥、常思善事、常行善業。
translation: Once they've long accomplished it, sometimes they walk up and down, sometimes they sit or lie down, always contemplate good deeds, and always perform good actions.

source_sentence: 時彼村人見彼喜樂號名法愛，謂求善故。
translation: Seeing that joy and happiness, the villagers then called it craving for the Dharma because they were seeking goodness.

source_sentence: 時時往詣仙人所承事供養，眾人見彼愛樂仙人勤修練行，復號其名以為練行。
translation: At the time, he went to the sage's place from time to time to serve and make offerings, and when people saw that delighted sage who diligently cultivated his training, they again called him by his name as his training practice.

source_sentence: 當於後時彼長者子身患毒瘡，以種種藥及諸呪法療治不差，然其父母將子共往詣仙人所白言：『仙人！
translation: Later, the elder's son was suffering from a poisonous sores in his body, and he treated him with various medicines and spells that didn't go away, but his parents went to the sage with their children and said, 'Sir, sage!

source_sentence: 侍者今患瘡極困，當願療治。』
translation: The attendant is now seriously ill with a sore, and he must wish to be cured.'

source_sentence: 時彼仙人即作實語發願：『今此長者子，於親於怨皆生平等無有異心。
translation: The sage then spoke the true words and made a vow, 'Now, this elder's son, there's no difference in his mind between relatives and enemies.

source_sentence: 若是實言，毒當除愈。』
translation: If this is true, the poison will be healed.'

source_sentence: 發此願已，毒瘡當時即得除愈。」
translation: After making this vow, the poisonous sores will then be healed.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時長者子者，即我身是。
translation: The elderly man's son at the time was me.

source_sentence: 時仙人者，即十力大迦葉身是，於彼時中為發真實願故，病得除愈；
translation: The ṛṣi of that time was the great Kāśyapa in the form of the Ten-Powerful One. At that time his illness was cured because he had undertaken a true vow.

source_sentence: 今時亦復如是。」
translation: So it is now.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多意生悔過：「我於喬答摩沙門，以石擊打不能損害，無益於事，眾人皆知虛獲惡名。」
translation: Devadatta then repented, saying, I can't harm the Gautama ascetic by beating him with a stone, and it doesn't help anything; everyone knows that he's gaining a bad reputation.

source_sentence: 其提婆達多即於樹下，結跏趺坐諦自思惟。
translation: Devadatta then sat cross-legged under a tree and thought to himself.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻見提婆達多已，各共籌量思惟議論：「提婆達多於如來所有如是嗔恨，以石擊打如來。」
translation: When the monks saw Devadatta, they each deliberated and discussed together, Devadatta had this kind of anger toward the Tathāgata and beat him with a stone.

source_sentence: 時孤迦里迦苾芻是提婆達多朋友，告諸苾芻：「汝具壽等不能諦思非語即語，汝等不見提婆達多今在彼樹住於四禪，是大人者不作惡事。」
translation: The orphaned Kālīyaka monk was Devadatta's friend, and he told the monks, You Kauṣṭhila and others can't contemplate what's not spoken or said, so you don't see Devadatta standing in that tree at the fourth dhyāna now; this is a great person who doesn't do bad things.

source_sentence: 時苾芻等心生疑惑，唯佛世尊能斷疑惑。
translation: The monks and others then had doubts in their minds, but only the Bhagavān was able to stop doubts.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻白佛言，如上所說。
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, As explained above.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多朋友苾芻孤迦里迦等見白佛已，訶諸苾芻：「汝等自無羞恥，即說我提婆達多云作惡事。」
translation: When Devadatta's friend, the monks and nuns Anāthapiṇḍika and others saw him and said to the Buddha, Reprimanded the monks, You have no shame in telling me that Devadatta has done bad things.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「孤迦里迦往昔之時亦復即說無羞恥事。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, Isolated Kālīyaka also explained that he had no shame.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 如往昔之時，於王舍城有王，先立勅條令事王人，置兩摩舍那：一著丈夫、一著婦人。
translation: As in the past, when there was a king in Rājagṛha, he first established an edict ordering the king's men to serve him and placed two kinds of mansions: one for men and one for women.

source_sentence: 丈夫屍林著女婦，女婦屍林著丈夫。
translation: A man's corpse forest is attached to a woman, and a woman's corpse forest is attached to a man.

source_sentence: 爾時後有一黃門死，將往深摩舍那，其丈夫屍林守人不令放著，其婦女屍林亦不聽著，二俱無處。
translation: It was then that a man of the yellow gate died and was about to go deep into the mocana, where his husband's corpse-forest guard didn't allow him to let it go, and the woman's corpse-forest didn't allow him to do so; there weren't two places for him.

source_sentence: 於王舍城不遠，有一林所，花樹林菓茂盛可愛，有諸雜鳥出和雅音。
translation: Not far from the city of Rājagṛha there was a forest with plenty of flowers, trees, and fruit. There were various kinds of birds singing in harmonious voices.

source_sentence: 有一仙人居止其中，根菓為食飲清泉水被樹皮衣。
translation: A sage lived there, eating roots and fruits for food and drinking from the clear spring water, wearing a tree bark robe.

source_sentence: 近彼方所耕地之處，有楩麻樹，其人將此死屍置楩麻樹下。
translation: Near the place where the corpse was buried, there was a tree of black and hemp. The man placed the corpse beneath that tree.

source_sentence: 時有野犴聞死屍臭，尋氣而來即食死人。
translation: A wild boar then smelled the odor of the dead corpse and came out to eat it.

source_sentence: 有一老烏在於楩麻樹上藏隱而住，便自思惟：『我今好讚野犴，彼應與我少多飡食。』
translation: An old crow was hiding and staying in seclusion on a mango tree, and he thought to himself, 'Now that I'm fond of praising the wild elephants, they should give me a little bit of food.'

source_sentence: 「『汝胸如師子，　　腰復似牛王；
translation: 'Your chest is like a lion, And your waist resembles a king of bulls.

source_sentence: 我禮獸中主，　　與我食飡者。』
translation: I bow to the lord of the animals, who gave me food and drink.'

source_sentence: 「『誰居叢上樹，　　後生中最勝；
translation: 'Who lives in a tree in a jungle, the most superior among those who are born later?

source_sentence: 身色照諸處，　　如寶作一團。』
translation: The body's form illuminates all places like a lump of treasure.'

source_sentence: 「『我多有用具，　　故為見汝來；
translation: 'I have many necessities, so I want to see you come.

source_sentence: 今我禮獸王，　　有殘食與我。』
translation: Now, I'll pay homage to the king of animals, and he'll give me some leftover food.'

source_sentence: 「『汝項如孔雀，　　烏鳥甚可愛；
translation: 'Your neck is like a peacock, and the crow is very desirable.

source_sentence: 聲鳴最勝妙，　　任汝來取食。』
translation: The sound is most wonderful and subtle, so please come and get food.'

source_sentence: 老烏以頌讚曰：「爾時野犴遍觀察已，以頌答曰：「老烏又以頌讚曰：「野犴還以頌答曰：「時烏下樹，共彼野犴同食死人。
translation: The old crow praised him in verse, saying, After he had observed it all over, the wild boar replied in verse, Old crow again praised him in verse, The wild boar returned and answered in verse, At that time, the crow went down from a tree and shared his wild boar with the dead man's food.

source_sentence: 「『多時見汝等，　　共合無羞者；
translation: 'Many times I see you, who are united together without shame.

source_sentence: 樹中最上音，　　所食人中賤。』
translation: It's the lowest sound among trees, and the people who eat it are the lowest.'

source_sentence: 「『師子孔雀飡，　　共食最上者；
translation: 'The lion and the peacock are devoured, And the best food is shared with them.

source_sentence: 禿人於此來，　　關爾何物事？』
translation: What's the matter with a baldie who comes here, and what's the matter with you?'

source_sentence: 「『老烏鳥中卑，　　野犴獸中賤；
translation: The old crow is the lowest among birds and the wild elephant is the lowest among animals.

source_sentence: 楩麻不堪樹，　　黃門人中下。
translation: Unworthy of the thorns and hemp, it's below the level of the yellow monks.

source_sentence: 地中三角醜，　　看此不識羞。』
translation: The triangle in the ground is ugly, and I don't know shame when I look at it.'

translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, there was a king named Baijiang in Vārāṇasī who governed his country, whose country was prosperous and well populated, and they all enjoyed peace and happiness.

translation: Near the border of that country, there was a king's daughter who married and married him together, had fun and played, and lived here happily.

source_sentence: 後時懷妊乃生一女，其女漸漸長大。
translation: Later, she became pregnant and gave birth to a daughter, who gradually grew up.

translation: She became pregnant and gave birth to a son after the full moon. The prince’s appearance was dignified and people liked to see him.

translation: He entrusts the eight milk mothers to attend and nourish his child (as explained in detail earlier), so when he's nurturing it with milk, cream, butter, ghee, and so forth, that child grows quickly like a lotus flower in water.
